availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: George W. Cook (Edmonson County, Kentucky, farmer)

body.p: Edmonson County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Married to Malinda Stewart in Edmonson County on March 10, 1840. Father of Francis P. Cook, Mary Jane Cook, Martin L. Cook, Amos D. Cook, John W. Cook, Christopher Cook, Malinda A. Cook, Newton H. Cook, and Mandy Cook. Farmer in Edmonson County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Edmonson County, Brownsville, p. 42.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Edmonson County, Brownsville, p. 24 / 28 on microfilm (accessed via Ancestry.com).
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Edmonson County Marriages, Film #000367220, p. 90.
